Compost Project at GP
Did you know that the amount of solid waste created in one year by everyone in the United States is enough to cover the entire country in a layer of trash? Glendale Prep is taking strides to become an environmentally conscious school. With the help of faculty, staff, students, and parents, we hope to have a school that encourages reducing, reusing, and recycling. One of our projects is to build a compost area for all food waste. It requires some material and a little bit of time. Our ‚Äú3R‚Äù ECNA students and teacher are on it, but it would be highly helpful if any GP family was willing to donate soil, a couple of shovels, gardening gloves and/or to participate in building the compost area (with plastic bins). Interested? Please contact Madame Cognet Pereira ASAP at cpereira@glendaleprep.org. We can‚Äôt change the past, but we can change the future. Reduce, Reuse and Recycle!

post_text: Glendale Preparatory Academy's 2019 Junior and Senior Promenade proved to be a wonderful time with friends, food, dancing, and "clues". We'd like to publicly thank Ms. Roiger for her dedication and hard work in making this event something beautiful for students to experience. We would also like to thank one of our own GP parents, Ms. Ziegler, for providing us with an amazing picture of this delightful evening. Finally, a heartfelt thanks to Mrs. Cecilia Mendoza for patiently teaching our students the waltz, foxtrot, and other classic ballroom dances each year in preparation for the promenade. This elegant night is a glimpse of the friendships and culture we have helped nurture, together. If you are a parent of a senior student, please savor these last few days with us together at Glendale Prep. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballroom_dance
